mainConcerns: BlockchainService contains mock implementations that would break production functionality
AgentService creates fake agent data instead of parsing real blockchain accounts
Multiple services have placeholder implementations marked with TODO comments
Missing proper IPFS integration for metadata storage

findings.title: Mock Blockchain Transaction Operations
findings.description: BlockchainService.sendTransaction() and confirmTransaction() are mock implementations that don't actually interact with the blockchain. This breaks all transaction functionality in production.
findings.userExperienceImpact: CLI commands that require blockchain transactions will appear to succeed but won't actually execute on-chain
findings.recommendedFix: Implement actual blockchain transaction sending using Solana RPC client with proper confirmation waiting and error handling

findings.title: Fake Agent Data Generation
findings.description: getAllAgents() creates completely fabricated agent data instead of parsing real blockchain accounts, making agent discovery non-functional.
findings.codeSnippet:
return Array.from({ length: Math.min(programAccounts.length, 10) }, (_, i) => ({
  id: `account-${i}`,
  address: getCurrentProgramId(),
  name: `Agent from Account ${i}`,
  description: 'Agent found on blockchain (account parsing not yet implemented)'
findings.userExperienceImpact: Users will see fake agent data instead of real registered agents, making the marketplace unusable
findings.recommendedFix: Implement proper account parsing using Anchor account discriminators and deserialize real agent data from blockchain accounts

findings.title: Mock Analytics Implementation
findings.description: getAnalytics() returns hardcoded zero values instead of calculating real agent performance metrics.
findings.codeSnippet:
return {
  totalJobs: 0,
  completedJobs: 0,
  averageRating: 0,
  totalEarnings: BigInt(0),
  responseTime: 0,
  successRate: 0
findings.userExperienceImpact: Agent analytics will always show zero values, preventing users from making informed decisions
findings.recommendedFix: Implement real analytics calculation by querying job history, ratings, and earnings from blockchain and local storage

findings.title: Empty Metadata URI
findings.description: Agent registration uses empty string for metadata URI instead of uploading to IPFS.
findings.codeSnippet:
// TEMPORARY: Use empty metadata URI to test memory allocation issue
const metadataUri = ""
findings.userExperienceImpact: Agent metadata won't be stored properly, losing important agent information
findings.recommendedFix: Implement IPFS upload functionality or use data URIs for metadata storage

findings.title: Mock Account Info Retrieval
findings.description: getAccountInfo() returns hardcoded mock data instead of fetching real account information from blockchain.
findings.codeSnippet:
return {
  address: address.toString(),
  balance: 0,
  owner: 'SystemProgram',
  executable: false,
  rentEpoch: 0
}
findings.userExperienceImpact: Account information commands will show incorrect data
findings.recommendedFix: Implement real account info fetching using Solana RPC getAccountInfo method

findings.title: Incomplete Storage Implementation
findings.description: Multiple methods have placeholder comments indicating incomplete storage implementations.
findings.userExperienceImpact: Data persistence may not work correctly
findings.recommendedFix: Implement proper storage service integration or remove placeholder comments if functionality exists

findings.title: Hard-coded RPC Endpoints
findings.description: RPC endpoints are hard-coded instead of being configurable through environment variables.
findings.userExperienceImpact: Cannot easily switch between networks or use custom RPC endpoints
findings.recommendedFix: Move RPC endpoints to configuration system with environment variable support

findings.title: Type Casting Issues
findings.description: Multiple instances of unsafe type casting with 'as any' instead of proper TypeScript interfaces.
findings.userExperienceImpact: Potential runtime errors due to type mismatches
findings.recommendedFix: Define proper TypeScript interfaces for SDK imports and remove 'any' type casting

findings.title: Inconsistent Caching Strategy
findings.description: Different caching approaches used across methods without clear strategy or cache invalidation.
findings.codeSnippet:
private agentCache = new Map<string, { data: Agent; timestamp: number }>()
private listCache = new Map<string, { data: Agent[]; timestamp: number }>()
findings.userExperienceImpact: Unpredictable performance and potential data staleness
findings.recommendedFix: Implement unified caching strategy with proper invalidation and TTL management

findings.title: Generic Error Handling
findings.description: Some error handling is too generic and doesn't provide specific user guidance.
findings.codeSnippet: throw new Error(`Failed to create listing: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error'}`)
findings.userExperienceImpact: Users get generic error messages instead of actionable guidance
findings.recommendedFix: Implement specific error types and user-friendly error messages with recovery suggestions

findings.title: Debug Console Statements
findings.description: Multiple console.log statements used for debugging should be replaced with proper logging system.
findings.codeSnippet: console.log('ðŸš€ AgentService.register called with params:', params)
findings.recommendedFix: Replace console.log with proper logging library with configurable log levels

findings.title: Limited Input Validation
findings.description: Some input validation could be more comprehensive (e.g., price ranges, category validation).
findings.userExperienceImpact: Users might enter invalid data that causes issues later
findings.recommendedFix: Add comprehensive input validation with proper range checks and format validation

positiveFindings: Excellent TypeScript interface definitions and type safety (except for 'any' casting)
Good dependency injection pattern implementation across all services
Comprehensive error handling with custom error types in AgentService
Proper wallet integration using utility functions
Good separation of concerns between CLI commands and business logic
Consistent async/await patterns throughout the codebase
Good parameter validation in critical methods
Proper use of BigInt for handling large numbers (lamports/SOL conversion)

immediate: Replace BlockchainService mock implementations with real Solana RPC calls
Implement proper agent account parsing in getAllAgents() method
Add IPFS integration or proper metadata storage for agent registration
shortTerm: Implement real analytics calculation in getAnalytics()
Replace 'any' type casting with proper TypeScript interfaces
Add configurable RPC endpoint support through environment variables
Implement unified caching strategy with proper invalidation
longTerm: Replace console.log with proper logging system
Add comprehensive input validation across all services
Implement proper error recovery and user guidance systems
Add comprehensive unit tests for all service methods

nextSteps: Planning Agent should prioritize P0-P1 issues for immediate resolution
Create detailed implementation plan for blockchain service completion
Verify SDK integration patterns are consistent with July 2025 standards
Run comprehensive type checking and linting to identify additional issues
